bulbasaur: It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As its body grows larger, the seed does too.
ivysaur: The bulb on its back grows as it absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off a pleasant aroma when it blooms.
venusaur: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.
charmander: If Charmander is healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously and won't go out even if it gets a bit wet.
charmeleon: It is very hotheaded by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents to battle against. Its aggression will not be quelled if it doesn't win.
charizard: It uses its wings to fly sky-high. The more experience it gains in battle, the greater the temperature at which its flames burn.
squirtle: Its shell is soft immediately after it is born. In no time at all, the shell becomes so resilient that a prodding finger will bounce right off it.
wartortle: It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. While swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
blastoise: It has jet nozzles on its shell. This impressive Pokémon uses these jets to charge toward foes with all the force of a rocket.
ekans: A very common sight in grasslands and such. It flicks its tongue in and out to sense danger in its surroundings.
arbok: This Pokémon is very tenacious. Once it targets its prey, it won't give up the chase, no matter how far the prey goes.
pikachu: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
pikachu-1: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across many different regions.
pikachu-2: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Hoenn region.
pikachu-3: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Sinnoh region.
pikachu-4: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Unova region.
pikachu-5: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Kalos region.
pikachu-6: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Alola region.
pikachu-7: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed as the two overcame many hardships together.
pikachu-9: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the world.
raichu: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
sandshrew: No matter how high a place it falls from, this Pokémon can save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
sandshrew-1: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.
sandslash: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
sandslash-1: A long, long time ago, it lived in the desert. With its sharp claws fully extended, it can run right up an iceberg without slipping.
clefairy: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
clefable: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
vulpix: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.
vulpix-1: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
ninetales: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
ninetales-1: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.
jigglypuff: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
wigglytuff: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it can't stop touching it.
oddish: When it is woken by moonlight, it wanders about. But during the day, it stays still underground.
gloom: It secretes a sticky, drool-like nectar. Though sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
vileplume: It fiendishly scatters allergenic pollen from its petals, which are the largest in the world.
venonat: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
venomoth: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
diglett: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
diglett-1: Its golden whiskers function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
dugtrio: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
dugtrio-1: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through even the hardest bedrock.
meowth: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.
persian: It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
psyduck: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
golduck: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow- moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
mankey: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.
primeape: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
growlithe: It's very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
arcanine: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can't help but grovel before it.
poliwag: Its legs are newly grown, and it can't walk very well. It seems to prefer swimming through the water instead.
poliwhirl: Its skin is moist all over its body. The skin on its belly spiral also feels smooth.
poliwrath: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
bellsprout: It plants its feet deep underground to rehydrate itself. While doing so, it's unable to run away if it's attacked.
weepinbell: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
victreebel: After dissolving many prey, this Pokémon's acid becomes sweeter. This makes it even easier to attract more prey.
tentacool: Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
tentacruel: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
geodude: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
geodude-1: If you step on a Geodude sleeping on the ground, you'll hear a zapping sound and feel a tingling shock throughout your entire body.
graveler: Moss-covered rocks are Graveler's favorite food. It consumes over a ton of them a day, crunching loudly while it eats.
graveler-1: Graveler's entire body is electrically charged due to the stones it likes to eat. It is a very quick-tempered Pokémon.
golem: It deliberately blows itself up, then uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
golem-1: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
slowpoke: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
slowpoke-1: It uses its tail to fish, but the scent of the spice emanating from its tail ensures its catches are always lacking.
slowbro: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokémon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
slowbro-2: Shellder bites down hard on Slowbro's arm to suck out more poison. This seems to cause itching, so Slowbro occasionally lashes out.
magnemite: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.
magneton: They're formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
doduo: Its heads never sleep at the same time—each one takes a turn keeping watch while the other sleeps, switching every hour or so.
dodrio: The strongest head with the thickest neck becomes the leader and gains primary control of the body.
seel: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
dewgong: It stores thermal energy in its body to fend off the cold. It swims at eight knots even in frigid waters.
grimer: When two of these Pokémon's bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
grimer-1: Alolan Grimer will gladly gobble up any kind of trash, making it a widely used and popular Pokémon at garbage disposal facilities.
muk: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
muk-1: What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so don't get too close.
shellder: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
cloyster: When attacked, it launches its spikes in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
gastly: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
haunter: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
gengar: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
drowzee: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
hypno: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
voltorb: It's usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
electrode: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of the Bomb Ball.
exeggcute: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.
exeggutor: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
exeggutor-1: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
hitmonlee: It has complete control over the ligaments in its legs, expanding and contracting them to double the reach of its kicks.
hitmonchan: Its fists are masses of muscle. It takes a break every three minutes to steady its breath and mood.
koffing: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air. That's why it's always slightly airborne.
weezing: When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
rhyhorn: Once it starts running, it won't stop—even if it crashes through boulders. This disposition is what's caused its habitat to expand.
rhydon: It evolved to walk using only its hind legs, which has allowed it to expand its habitat even onto steep mountains.
chansey: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
horsea: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
seadra: Its fin tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
scyther: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
electabuzz: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
magmar: Wavering flames similar to those of the sun appear on the surface of this Pokémon's body.
tauros: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd's protectors take pride in their battle-scarred horns.
tauros-1: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.
tauros-2: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.
tauros-3: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.
magikarp: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
gyarados: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
lapras: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
ditto: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
eevee: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
vaporeon: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can't be seen when it melts away into water.
jolteon: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
flareon: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
porygon: Porygon is an artificial Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely through cyberspace.
snorlax: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesn't bother it at all.
dratini: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
dragonair: It is called the divine Pokémon. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
dragonite: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
chikorita: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature of the area around it.
bayleef: The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.
meganium: Meganium's breath holds within it the power to revive grasses and plants that have withered.
cyndaquil: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
quilava: The fur covering this Pokémon's body never burns, no matter what. It can shrug off any kind of fire attack.
typhlosion: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
totodile: This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.
croconaw: It opens its huge jaws wide to attack. If it loses fangs while biting, they'll just keep on growing back, one after another.
feraligatr: Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on land.
sentret: If it encounters a foe, it will stand up on its tail, making itself look bigger than usual to intimidate them.
furret: It is nimble and has a very flexible body. Even if you get ahold of it, it'll slip right out of your arms.
hoothoot: Since it tells time precisely, some countries consider it to be a deity of wisdom, versed in the ways of the world.
noctowl: Its extremely soft wings make no sound in flight. It silently sneaks up on prey without being detected.
spinarak: Some fishers weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.
ariados: It wanders in search of food after darkness falls, never nesting in a specific place.
chinchou: It shoots positively and negatively charged electricity from the tips of its two antennae and stuns its opponents.
lanturn: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.
pichu: Despite this Pokémon's cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
cleffa: Since it is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies, it's said to come here by riding on a star.
igglybuff: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
mareep: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
flaaffy: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
ampharos: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the ocean's surface.
bellossom: After it grows up, it leaves the forest it was born in to form groups with other Bellossom. It breaks into dance when it gets excited.
marill: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it's fine even in rivers with strong currents.
azumarill: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
sudowoodo: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
politoed: It's the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
hoppip: Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found practically everywhere. This is because the wind carries this species all over the world.
skiploom: When the weather grows cold, Skiploom's flower closes and the Pokémon cannot photosynthesize, so it flies away to warmer regions.
jumpluff: Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, you'll be racked with coughs and itchiness.
aipom: Its tail moves with greater dexterity than its hands. Making deft use of this tail, Aipom lives high among the treetops.
sunkern: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
sunflora: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
yanma: It can see in all directions without moving its big eyes, helping it spot both attackers and prey right away.
wooper: When it walks around on land, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
wooper-1: It's dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.
quagsire: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on riverbed boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
espeon: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy's actions.
umbreon: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
murkrow: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
slowking: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
slowking-1: It creates potions by mixing toxins with the food it's eaten. Not even Slowking itself knows what effects the potions will have.
misdreavus: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
girafarig: Girafarig's tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.
pineco: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.
forretress: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
dunsparce: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
gligar: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
snubbull: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.
granbull: It can make most any Pokémon run away by opening its big mouth to reveal its thick fangs.
qwilfish: Experienced fishers say they try to catch Qwilfish in the brief moment that these Pokémon become defenseless just after launching poisonous spikes.
qwilfish-1: It absorbs toxins from the food it eats. The distinct purple spikes on its body are evidence of its potent poison.
scizor: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
heracross: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
sneasel: This is a smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.
teddiursa: Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon have a smile back on its face.
ursaring: It is quite skilled at climbing trees. If it comes across a Primeape while searching for berries in the treetops, trouble will surely ensue.
slugma: It's said that in ancient times, when volcanoes were more active, there were many more Slugma than there are now.
magcargo: According to folklore, a sudden increase in the wild Magcargo population heralds a volcanic eruption.
swinub: It rubs its snout against the ground, digging through the soil as it searches for food. Sometimes it digs up hot springs.
piloswine: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
delibird: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.
skarmory: Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.
houndour: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
houndoom: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
kingdra: This Pokémon is said to sleep at the bottom of the sea—deeper than any other life-form can descend—building its energy.
phanpy: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.
donphan: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.
porygon2: Porygon was upgraded to become capable of planetary development. However, this upgraded version cannot even fly yet.
stantler: It's said that this Pokémon used to be stronger long ago when it had many enemies, and that it was even able to evolve under its own power.
smeargle: The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from the tip of the tail is predetermined for each Smeargle.
tyrogue: Its intense desire to become stronger and stronger drives it to recklessly train its body and challenge any opponent it can find to battle.
hitmontop: It spins on its horn while dealing out elegant kicks. Its horn grows continuously through its lifetime.
elekid: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.
magby: Magma-like blood circulates throughout this Pokémon's body, raising its body temperature as high as 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
blissey: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.
larvitar: It is born deep underground. It can't emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.
pupitar: Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
tyranitar: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
treecko: Treecko can quickly scale even vertical surfaces. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day's weather.
grovyle: Grovyle leaps from branch to branch in large trees, moving with ease. It propels itself with astounding speed and force.
sceptile: The leaves on its arms are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike its enemies.
torchic: In its belly, it has a sac filled with burning fire, meaning that Torchic feels as warm as a hot-water bottle if you hug it.
combusken: When it enters battle, the flame inside its body burns stronger. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
blaziken: It can jump powerfully, clearing a 30-story building in a single leap. Its flaming punches scorch its opponents.
mudkip: When it uses its large tail fin, it picks up speed rapidly in the water. It is strong in spite of its small size.
marshtomp: It is at its best when on muddy ground that offers poor footing. It quickly overwhelms opponents that are bogged down and unable to move.
swampert: Swampert's arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down Swampert's foes. This Pokémon makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
poochyena: Poochyena pursue their prey in packs. Once the prey is exhausted, the pack finishes it off. But sometimes the prey retaliates, and the pack flees.
mightyena: Once it's caught the scent of faraway prey, the leader gives a signal, and the whole pack moves out.
lotad: Lotad will gather in lakes that have good water quality. The surfaces of these lakes sometimes become covered in Lotad leaves.
lombre: It prefers waterfronts with plentiful food. It became nocturnal so it wouldn't have to compete for food with bird Pokémon.
ludicolo: Dancing with an upbeat rhythm energizes and emboldens it, letting it face any foe without fear.
seedot: Seedot live in trees, hanging from the branches and leeching moisture. Rows of them can be found dangling from large, young trees.
nuzleaf: Its sensory functions are concentrated in its pointed nose, which it uses to sense its surroundings. The nose is also its weak point.
shiftry: Legends tell of a bird Pokémon that received divine punishment for its evil deeds and had its beak and wings replaced.
wingull: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
pelipper: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
ralts: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
kirlia: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
gardevoir: It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.
surskit: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
masquerain: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
shroomish: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
breloom: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
slakoth: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
vigoroth: It is always hungry because it won't stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can't keep still.
slaking: This Pokémon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
makuhita: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
hariyama: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
azurill: Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.
nosepass: When endangered, it may protect itself by increasing its magnetism and drawing nearby iron objects to its body.
sableye: Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.
meditite: It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.
medicham: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.
plusle: This Pokémon absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out the electricity stored inside its body to create noises.
minun: Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
volbeat: It flashes the light on its rear to communicate with other Volbeat. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
illumise: It guides Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. There are scholars who research the meaning of these signs.
gulpin: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
swalot: It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.
numel: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
camerupt: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.
torkoal: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
spoink: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.
grumpig: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.
trapinch: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.
vibrava: It generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously vibrating its wings. After making its prey faint, it dissolves the prey with its digestive juices.
flygon: The sound of its wings flapping resembles singing. Those entranced by this sound get lured into a sandstorm and become Flygon's prey.
cacnea: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
cacturne: It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the desert's heat.
swablu: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
altaria: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.
zangoose: If it comes across a Seviper, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.
seviper: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It's Zangoose's archrival.
barboach: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
whiscash: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
corphish: It can live in impure water, where it doesn't need to compete with other water Pokémon for food, so its numbers have steadily increased.
crawdaunt: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
feebas: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.
milotic: It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes people's minds and hearts.
shuppet: It feeds on the dark emotions of sadness and hatred, which make it grow steadily stronger.
banette: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.
duskull: Duskull's victims suffer an intense chill as the Pokémon siphons their life-force away, glaring at them with its bright red eye all the while.
dusclops: Dusclops's true form is said to be a bright red eye burning within its body, but no one has ever seen such a thing.
tropius: Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.
chimecho: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
snorunt: It is said that a home visited by a Snorunt will prosper. It can withstand cold of −150 degrees Fahrenheit.
glalie: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
luvdisc: During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
bagon: Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.
shelgon: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
salamence: It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.
beldum: All its cells are magnets. It communicates with others of its kind by transmitting magnetic forces from its body.
metang: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
metagross: It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and large body. Then Metagross uses the mouth on its stomach to chew its prey to bits.
turtwig: It uses its whole body to photosynthesize when exposed to sunlight. Its shell is made from hardened soil.
grotle: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
torterra: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra's back and spend their entire life there.
chimchar: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
monferno: A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means it holds a higher rank in its troop.
infernape: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
piplup: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
prinplup: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
empoleon: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will mercilessly decimate anything that threatens the safety of its colony.
starly: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
staravia: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
staraptor: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
kricketot: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
kricketune: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
shinx: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's in trouble.
luxio: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
luxray: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
cranidos: Cranidos toughen up their already sturdy heads by headbutting one another.
rampardos: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
shieldon: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. It's thought that Shieldon had few enemies thanks to its sturdy face.
bastiodon: Bastiodon live in herds. When assaulted by enemies, they line up side by side and use their hard faces to block attacks.
combee: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers nectar from flowers to please Vespiquen.
vespiquen: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.
pachirisu: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
buizel: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
floatzel: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.
shellos: It oozes a purple fluid to deter enemies. Apparently, there are more West Sea Shellos now than there were in the past.
shellos-1: This Pokémon can often be seen along seashores. It's capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.
gastrodon: It appears on beaches where the waters are shallow. Once it catches prey, it will slowly melt them with its mucus before slurping them up.
gastrodon-1: Fishers say that they didn't see many of these Pokémon in the past, but this form of Gastrodon is now increasing in number.
ambipom: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
drifloon: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “signpost for wandering spirits.”
drifblim: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can't be a fixed destination.
mismagius: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
honchkrow: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
chingling: It emits high-frequency cries that people can't hear. Once it starts, it can cry for an awfully long time.
stunky: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.
skuntank: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.
bronzor: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.
bronzong: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
bonsly: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
happiny: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.
spiritomb: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
gible: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
gabite: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
garchomp: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
munchlax: When it is voraciously gulping down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
riolu: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions, such as joy and rage, in the form of waves.
lucario: A well-trained one can use its aura to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
hippopotas: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.
hippowdon: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
croagunk: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
toxicroak: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
finneon: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
lumineon: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
snover: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
abomasnow: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
weavile: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
magnezone: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magneton's molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.
rhyperior: A Rhyperior's brain is smaller than a Rhydon's, but the Rhyperior is stronger because it spends more energy on battling and less on brainpower.
electivire: This Pokémon presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent and instantly sends over 20,000 volts of high-voltage electricity through them.
magmortar: They dwell in volcanic craters. It's said that only a single pair of Magmortar will inhabit any given volcano.
yanmega: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
leafeon: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
glaceon: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
gliscor: It flies soundlessly through the sky. It catches prey with its long tail, then lunges at the prey's vulnerable spots with its fangs.
mamoswine: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up, to much amazement.
porygon-z: Its programming was modified to enable it to operate in other dimensions. This did not work as planned.
gallade: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
probopass: Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while it's around.
dusknoir: It comes and goes between this world and the afterlife. People fear this Pokémon because it is said to suck in lost spirits and take them along.
froslass: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
rotom: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
rotom-1: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven. It will sear the surrounding area with its burning heat, then smile in delight.
rotom-2: The model of washing machine that Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued, so these appliances are now traded at high prices.
rotom-3: The special motor within the refrigerator is the key to bringing about Rotom's change in form.
rotom-4: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.
rotom-5: This Rotom has possessed a lawn mower. It will mow down grass and flowers, then swagger around with pride at its accomplishments.
snivy: It prefers to avoid groups. In its day-to-day life, it dexterously controls its vines to compensate for its short arms.
servine: Servine's one weakness is its inflated sense of pride. It takes a while for Servine to be able to cooperate with other Pokémon.
serperior: An intimidating gaze and majestic appearance have caused this Pokémon to be known as the Lord of the Forest.
tepig: This Pokémon is a ravenous glutton. It uses its excellent sense of smell to find food, then cooks it to a crisp before eating.
pignite: When defending its friends, Pignite will stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong. But it's powerless when faced with an empty stomach.
emboar: The direr the situation, the more it seems to enjoy itself. The flames around its neck intensify, too, increasing Emboar's power and speed.
oshawott: It's said that Oshawott learned to maintain its scalchop with riverbed stones by mimicking humans it saw using whetstones.
dewott: Dewott has a studious and stern personality. It masters the use of its scalchops through dedicated, repeated training.
samurott: Samurott leads its group strictly. Those who do not follow its rules receive a merciless thrashing.
blitzle: This Pokémon prefers places with lots of lightning strikes. It catches lightning with its mane and stores the electricity within its body.
zebstrika: Once the herd hears thunder, it chases after the storm clouds so that the Blitzle in the group can use the lightning to charge up.
drilbur: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
excadrill: Its drill, which has evolved into steel, is strong enough to bore through iron plates. This Pokémon is a great help in tunnel construction.
timburr: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.
gurdurr: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
conkeldurr: Rather than rely on their strength, they master moves that make good use of centrifugal force to swing around concrete.
sewaddle: The bumps on their heads are sensory organs. When Sewaddle meet, they greet each other by rubbing these bumps together.
swadloon: Swadloon wraps itself in leaves for protection. It uses the two leaves atop its head to detect air movements and feel out its surroundings.
leavanny: It fashions clothing from woven leaves. Though gentle in disposition, it will show no mercy to foes who target young Pokémon.
cottonee: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
whimsicott: It rides on the wind and slips into people's homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
petilil: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
lilligant: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
basculin: It's so vicious that it's called the Thug of the River. Yet Basculin is still targeted by predators, such as Dondozo and Bombirdier.
basculin-1: The power of its jaws is immense—enough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.
basculin-2: Its ecology is starkly different from that of other Basculin, so theories that it's a totally different species have gained traction in recent years.
sandile: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
krokorok: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
krookodile: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
scraggy: It will abruptly headbutt anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is extremely hard.
scrafty: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
zorua: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
zoroark: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
minccino: These Pokémon like things neat and tidy. They are always sweeping and dusting their habitat, using their tails as brooms.
cinccino: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
gothita: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.
gothorita: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokémon came from outer space.
gothitelle: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.
solosis: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
duosion: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
reuniclus: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
ducklett: It strengthens its body by diving into the depths of ponds, swimming around while looking for bog moss to eat.
swanna: It's said that many artists have taken inspiration from the sight of a Swanna performing a beautiful dance in the light of dawn.
deerling: Despite Deerling's adorable appearance, farmers consider it a nuisance since it loves plant shoots and will eat them all up.
deerling-1: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.
deerling-2: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.
deerling-3: This Pokémon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.
sawsbuck: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.
sawsbuck-1: This Pokémon's leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldea's is especially aromatic.
sawsbuck-2: Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.
sawsbuck-3: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.
foongus: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.
amoonguss: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.
alomomola: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
joltik: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
galvantula: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
tynamo: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.
eelektrik: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
eelektross: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
litwick: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life-force of any who follow it.
lampent: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
chandelure: It absorbs spirits, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
axew: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.
fraxure: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.
haxorus: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.
cubchoo: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you'll get frostbite.
beartic: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.
cryogonal: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.
mienfoo: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.
mienshao: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
golett: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
golurk: Golurk were created by ancient people to protect both people and Pokémon. They run on a mysterious energy.
pawniard: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.
bisharp: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
rufflet: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it's a carnivore at heart.
braviary: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
vullaby: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.
mandibuzz: Watching from the sky, they attack weakened prey on the ground. They have a habit of decorating themselves with bones.
deino: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
zweilous: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
hydreigon: It's said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.
larvesta: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.
volcarona: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it's in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.
chespin: Eating lots of berries makes the bark shell that covers Chespin's head and body grow sturdier.
quilladin: It can send a trailer flying with a tackle. It's numb to pain, so even violent collisions don't faze it.
chesnaught: Its gentle disposition would have it avoid conflict, but it gives opponents a thrashing with its thorned fists when the situation calls for it.
fennekin: Twigs make for Fennekin's snacks. When it nibbles on twigs, it finds the courage to face strong foes.
braixen: Braixen's branch ignites as it's pulled from the Pokémon's tail. Braixen then uses the flame to spark powerful attacks.
delphox: It controls flames telekinetically, trapping its foes in a fiery vortex surpassing 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit and burning them to a crisp.
froakie: It utilizes its extraordinary jumping abilities to flummox its foes, throwing springy bubbles at them from above their heads.
frogadier: The tips of its fingers and toes stick firmly to vertical surfaces. Frogadier can scale skyscrapers with ease.
greninja: It makes shuriken out of mucus excreted from its thighs. These shuriken can cut cleanly through steel cables.
fletchling: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.
fletchinder: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.
talonflame: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.
scatterbug: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.
spewpa: Spewpa doesn't live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.
vivillon: This Pokémon was born in frigid lands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-1: This Pokémon was born in a snowy land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-2: This Pokémon was born in a land of severe cold. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-3: This Pokémon was born in a land of vast space. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-4: This Pokémon was born in a verdant land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-5: This Pokémon was born in a land with distinct seasons. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-6: This Pokémon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-7: This Pokémon was born in a sun-drenched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-8: This Pokémon was born in a land with ocean breezes. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-9: This Pokémon was born in a place with many islands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-10: This Pokémon was born in a land with little rain. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-11: This Pokémon was born in a parched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-12: This Pokémon was born in a land where large rivers flow. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-13: This Pokémon was born in a land with intense rainfall. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-14: This Pokémon was born in a land with a tropical climate. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-15: This Pokémon was born in a land bathed in light. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-16: This Pokémon was born in a land of perpetual summer. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-17: This Pokémon was born in a land of tropical rain forests. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-18: This Pokémon was born in a mysterious land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
vivillon-19: This Pokémon was born in a special land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
litleo: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.
pyroar: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.
flabebe: This Flabébé rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokémon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.
flabebe-1: It unleashes a variety of moves by drawing forth the power hidden within flowers. This Pokémon is particularly fond of yellow flowers.
flabebe-2: It receives strength from flowers and gives them some of its energy in return. This Pokémon likes orange flowers best of all.
flabebe-3: This Pokémon likes blue flowers best of all. It floats upward using the power emanating from its flower and bobs along lightly through the air.
flabebe-4: When evening falls, it searches out a place blooming with flowers of the same white color as itself, and then it goes to sleep.
floette: This Pokémon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.
floette-1: Floette can draw forth the latent capabilities of Grass-type Pokémon. It syncs with yellow flowers.
floette-2: This Pokémon cannot use moves on its own. When it syncs with flowers, it becomes able to use Grass-type moves.
floette-3: It exchanges power with flowers via wavelengths of visible light. This form of Floette can sync with the wavelength that produces the color blue.
floette-4: If it finds someone messing up a flower bed, it will attack them without mercy. This Floette takes particularly good care of white flowers.
florges: They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.
florges-1: This Pokémon battles by drawing forth the power of yellow flowers. It ruthlessly punishes anyone who tramples on flowering plants.
florges-2: In times long past, castle governors would lovingly raise Florges to care for their castles' exquisite gardens.
florges-3: Blue pigments were tremendously expensive in the past, so paintings of blue Florges are highly valuable.
florges-4: A Florges adorned with white flowers can sync with the wavelengths of various colors to draw forth their power.
skiddo: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.
gogoat: These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.
espurr: Behind an Espurr's expressionless face is a frantic struggle to contain psychic power.
meowstic: If Meowstic continuously emits its powerful psychic energy, it will damage its own body.
meowstic-1: When they sense danger, they exert their psychic power at its maximum output. They have no regard for their opponents.
inkay: Being upside-down improves its blood flow and clears its mind, causing the power of its psychic moves to increase dramatically.
malamar: It flashes the luminescent spots on its body to hypnotize its opponents, gaining total control over them.
skrelp: This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it's caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.
dragalge: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.
clauncher: Clauncher's claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn't appeal to all tastes.
clawitzer: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.
sylveon: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents' weak spots.
hawlucha: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.
dedenne: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.
carbink: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
goomy: Goomy's horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomy's senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.
sliggoo: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated— it'll dissolve anything.
goodra: This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.
klefki: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.
phantump: This Pokémon came to be when the spirit of a deceased child possessed a tree stump. It now wanders the forest searching for friends.
trevenant: Trevenant is very kind to Pokémon living in the forest. It doesn't even care if these Pokémon take up residence in the greenery on its head.
bergmite: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of −148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.
avalugg: This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When it's floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.
noibat: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.
noivern: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.
rowlet: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to nestle into its Trainer's bag or the front of their jacket.
dartrix: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
decidueye: It nocks its arrow quills and looses them at opponents. When it needs to hit, it pulls the vines on its hood to narrow its view and focus.
litten: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
torracat: Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they've grown close, but it's a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.
incineroar: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
popplio: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
brionne: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try to help.
primarina: Also known as a songstress, it is a sight to behold on moonlit nights when it sings in front of the colony it leads.
pikipek: Pikipek has strong muscles in its neck, so it won't hurt itself even if it violently shakes its head.
trumbeak: When it encounters foes, it launches the many seeds stored in its beak in a radial burst.
toucannon: Pairs of Toucannon are considered symbols of companionship, as these Pokémon will raise the temperature of their beaks to warm each other.
yungoos: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.
gumshoos: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesn't seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.
grubbin: It spits sticky threads and winds them around branches, then swings nimbly from tree to tree in a pendulum-like motion.
charjabug: As it digests fallen leaves, it generates and stores electricity, which it can discharge from the tips of its jaws.
vikavolt: When carrying a Charjabug, Vikavolt can receive electricity from it and then rapidly fire powerful electromagnetic beams from its large jaws.
crabrawler: If it loses its pincers, they'll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.
crabominable: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon's movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.
oricorio: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.
oricorio-1: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
oricorio-2: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.
oricorio-3: The elegant, attractive dance of these Oricorio is popular with adults, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
cutiefly: Cutiefly sucks up pollen and nectar with its long proboscis. It stores any pollen it doesn't finish eating in its fur.
ribombee: Pollen puffs created by skilled Ribombee can relieve fatigue, making the puffs a popular commodity.
rockruff: This Pokémon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.
lycanroc: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.
lycanroc-1: This Lycanroc has an extremely vicious temperament. It will happily sustain injuries for the sake of taking down its opponent.
lycanroc-2: These Pokémon have both calm and ferocious qualities. It's said that this form of Lycanroc is the most troublesome to raise.
mareanie: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavor—they're not suitable as food.
toxapex: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.
mudbray: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn't change even when it's loaded with 50 times its own body weight.
mudsdale: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.
dewpider: It supports the water bubble that envelops its head with three of its legs. Sometimes it secretly swaps which legs are holding up the bubble.
araquanid: It launches sticky water bubbles. Foes who lose consciousness while trapped inside these bubbles will get torn apart by Araquanid's gnashing jaws.
fomantis: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.
lurantis: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer's attentiveness to the test.
salandit: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.
salazzle: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other's group.
bounsweet: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokémon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.
steenee: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.
tsareena: This Pokémon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.
comfey: It prefers areas with lots of flowers. A Comfey adorned with flowers is a happy Comfey, and the flowers gain healing effects.
oranguru: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.
passimian: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.
sandygast: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they're blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.
palossand: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.
minior: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-1: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-2: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-3: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-4: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-5: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-6: It will react when touched or called to, but it's unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
minior-7: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-8: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-9: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-10: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-11: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-12: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
minior-13: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
komala: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala's drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.
mimikyu: Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokémon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.
mimikyu-1: It has taken damage and can no longer hold the head of its cloth disguise upright. For as long as it lives, Mimikyu will never forget its attacker.
bruxish: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.
jangmo-o: They communicate with their allies using the sounds their scales make when struck. A group of these Pokémon causes quite a racket.
hakamo-o: It fires itself up by striking its scales with force as it dances. Its roar is a battle cry.
kommo-o: It bashes its scales to test its opponents' mettle. The sound of struck Kommo-o scales frightens weaker foes and sends them running.
grookey: As Grookey strikes everything in sight with its stick, it has more and more fun, and its rhythm becomes livelier.
thwackey: It becomes intensely focused while it drums out vigorous beats—so much so that sometimes it won't listen to its Trainer's commands.
rillaboom: When one Rillaboom challenges another who leads a troop, a drumming battle commences. The victor becomes the troop's new boss.
scorbunny: Fire energy gathers in the pads of its feet, raising their temperature. Once hot, Scorbunny's footpads can deal heavy damage to opponents.
raboot: While it prides itself on its varied kicking moves, it can also deliver powerful headbutts once its flames have heated up its forehead.
cinderace: Using a ball that it made out of flames, Cinderace blinds its opponents and keeps them at bay.
sobble: It's a very cautious Pokémon. When it has no choice but to battle, it hides itself before attacking.
drizzile: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it defends its home by laying traps.
inteleon: It may present itself as being well-mannered, but deep down, it still has a lazy side. It will slack off when its Trainer isn't looking.
skwovet: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.
greedent: This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.
rookidee: The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidee's wings, it'll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.
corvisquire: This intelligent Pokémon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.
corviknight: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies through the skies with ease.
chewtle: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.
drednaw: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.
rolycoly: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon's body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.
carkol: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol's back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.
coalossal: It's gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.
applin: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
flapple: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.
appletun: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun's back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.
silicobra: Silicobra's large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokémon is not very good at telling apart different smells.
sandaconda: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandaconda's saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.
cramorant: It's an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.
cramorant-1: Cramorant takes advantage of Arrokuda's frantic thrashing to help spit Arrokuda out at high speed.
cramorant-2: With a Pikachu stuck in its throat, Cramorant can use Pikachu's prickling electricity to give its opponents a shock.
arrokuda: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda's eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.
barraskewda: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.
toxel: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.
toxtricity: The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.
toxtricity-1: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.
sinistea: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.
sinistea-1: This Sinistea lives in an antique teacup. As valuable as this Pokémon is, its awful taste remains unchanged.
polteageist: These Pokémon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.
polteageist-1: Though risky to drink, this Pokémon's tea tastes delicious. Gourmets who have no fear of danger drink Polteageist tea day after day.
hatenna: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.
hattrem: The moment this Pokémon finds someone who's emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.
hatterene: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterene's territory.
impidimp: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.
morgrem: This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. It's popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.
grimmsnarl: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasn't given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.
milcery: When attacked, it tackles its foe and covers them in cream. With its foe either blinded or astonished by deliciousness, Milcery flees.
alcremie: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.
alcremie-1: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with sweet and tart flavors.
alcremie-2: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with an aromatic flavor.
alcremie-3: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a refreshing flavor.
alcremie-4: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a sour flavor.
alcremie-5: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a salty flavor.
alcremie-6: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a mix of flavors.
alcremie-7: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a bitter flavor.
alcremie-8: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with complex flavors.
falinks: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when it's time to change formation.
pincurchin: This Pokémon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.
snom: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.
frosmoth: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.
stonjourner: This Pokémon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.
eiscue: If you lick the ice covering its face, you'll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.
eiscue-1: Contrary to its looks, Eiscue is a poor swimmer. It creates ice balls at the tip of its single hair to lure prey in and fish them up.
indeedee: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer's side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.
indeedee-1: In search of happy feelings—such as joy and gratitude—Indeedee bustles around, taking diligent care of people and other Pokémon.
morpeko: It has a small stomach. If it isn't constantly eating the seeds it keeps in its pockets, it will get hungry immediately.
morpeko-1: Hunger has disrupted this Pokémon's hormonal balance. The Electric-type energy stored in its cheek sacs has turned into Dark-type energy.
cufant: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokémon feed.
copperajah: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokémon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.
